speaker: Eldhollow Village
line: Smoke hangs low over slate roofs. The bell tower stands quiet, as if listening for something it cannot afford to hear.

speaker: Village Elder Merrow
line: You walk like you’ve seen ruin before. Good. We have enough soft-hearted strangers buried in our gardens.

choices.text: I can help—if you speak plainly.

speaker: Village Elder Merrow
line: Plainly? Fine. People vanish. Not all at once—one a night, sometimes two. The dogs won’t cross the lane by the well. And the bell… the bell rings without hands.

speaker: Blacksmith Rusk
line: And before you ask: no, we’re not cursed because someone offended a spirit. We’re cursed because someone thinks we’re easy.

speaker: Watchman Sable
line: Tracks go nowhere when the fog is in a mood. But I’ve seen lantern-light move on the ridge—Ashpath direction—too steady for drunks.

speaker: Village Elder Merrow
line: If you truly mean to help, don’t promise us miracles. Promise us something smaller: that you’ll come back with the truth, even if the truth is ugly.

speaker: Eldhollow Village
line: The bell remains silent. That, somehow, feels worse than the ringing.
